intro: Rhexia filiformis, commonly known as slenderleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has small, showy blue to purple flowers. Its leaves are narrow and linear, contributing to its common name. Rhexia filiformis is often found in wetland habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in native plant gardens.
